warnings.message: Sprint 3.4 (Chaos Engineering Tests) uses 5 agents, approaching mesh topology limit of 7. Consider if hierarchical topology is needed.
Epic duration is 4 weeks with 14 sprints. Average sprint duration is ~2 days. Ensure sprint planning accounts for dependencies and blocking coordination delays.
Redis Single Point of Failure noted in scope as out-of-scope (Redis Sentinel/Cluster). Consider prioritizing HA setup before production deployment.

recommendations.recommendation: Execute all chaos tests in Phase 3 before proceeding to Phase 4 documentation. Chaos test failures may require revisiting Phase 1 or 2 implementations.
Phase 2 Sprint 2.3 (CFN Loop State Machine Integration) is critical for overall system coherence. Allocate extra validation time for this sprint.
Establish baseline performance metrics before Phase 1 implementation to measure the <5% performance impact requirement in risk mitigation.
Deploy monitoring dashboard (Sprint 3.1) early in Phase 3 to enable real-time tracking of subsequent sprints (3.2, 3.3, 3.4).
Sprint 4.3 requires 2-week staging validation. Plan epic timeline accordingly to include this extended validation period.
Consider creating draft documentation during Phase 1-3 implementation to reduce Phase 4 duration and capture implementation decisions while fresh.
